snippet: A statue of Heydar Aliyev, an Azerbaijan leader faulted for a poor human rights record, has raised concerns in Mexico City, a capital aspiring to be progressive.
abstract: Mexico City Journal; many Mexicans are puzzled by statue of former Azerbaijan leader Heydar Aliyev that graces Chapultepec Park in Mexico City; critics are pushing Mayor  Marcelo Ebrard to remove statue due to Aliyev's poor human rights record.

byline.contributor: Ellen Barry contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: A statue of Heydar Aliyev, an Azerbaijan leader faulted for a poor human rights record, has raised concerns in Mexico City, a capital aspiring to be progressive.

headline.seo: Statue of Azerbaijan Leader at Issue in Mexico City
headline.main: Statue of a Foreign Autocrat Sits Uneasily With Some
headline.print_headline: Statue of a Foreign Autocrat Sits Uneasily With Some

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
